instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.P3V3S5_EN_L: What is P3V3S5_EN_L? P3V3S5_EN_L is a signal that enables the power chip responsible for creating PP3V3_S5 when it is low. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Green/Orange light, no fan.
threads.message:
Board has bits of corrosion all over. Looks like someone sneezed over it. Ugh.

Green orange light as expected, but no fan spin.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.56
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.5
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.04
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0



Edit: Should <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> be low to be working? It measures 3.4v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Green/Orange light, no fan.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> should of course be there. <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> should be low. <SIGNAL>G2_EN</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Green/Orange light, no fan.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN_L</SIGNAL> = 3.499v

Diode mode on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7253</CAPACITOR> = 0.005v Guessing a  short on that line?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Green/Orange light, no fan.
threads.message:
Nice how you did not answer my question.....

"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.04" I doubt a short is there then!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Green/Orange light, no fan.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 19921"]Nice how you did not answer my question.....

"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.04" I doubt a short is there then![/QUOTE]

I somehow pasted the wrong line,
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.499.

And <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7253</CAPACITOR> is reading 0.005v in Diode.... I must have copied the wrong lines somehow. Sorry about that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Green/Orange light, no fan.
threads.message: Yeah that would be a short then. Not going to be fun as these is so much crap on <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> including the PCH. Inject 3V and see what heats up, I suspect there will be more than one component that is dead. Probably <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> went high and killed stuff.
